info.smart_tools.smartactors.core.message_processing

Interface IMessageProcessingSequence

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageProcessingSequence

    public interface IMessageProcessingSequence
    Object managing order of operations executed on a single message. May be used for processing o new messages when processing of current one is finished (see reset()). Contains reference to a IReceiverChain (called main chain) used to process new messages. New chains may be substituted using callChain(IReceiverChain) method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Interrupt execution of current chain by execution of a given one and when it is completed continue the previous.

      Switch to the chain that should be executed when exception occurs.

      IObject getCurrentReceiverArguments()
      Get the arguments object that should be passed to current receiver.
      void goTo(int level, int step)
      Go to specific step at some level of stack of nested chains.
      boolean next()
      Switch current receiver reference to next receiver that should receive the message.
      void reset()
      Start processing of (new) message from first receiver of main chain.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        void reset()
        Start processing of (new) message from first receiver of main chain.

      • next

        boolean next()
        Switch current receiver reference to next receiver that should receive the message.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one more receiver that should receive the message and false if not

      • goTo

        void goTo(int level,
          int step)
   throws InvalidArgumentException
        Go to specific step at some level of stack of nested chains.
        Parameters:
        level - the stack level to go to
        step - the step at that stack level
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if level is negative number
        InvalidArgumentException - if level is higher than current stack level

      • getCurrentReceiver

        IMessageReceiver getCurrentReceiver()
        Get the next receiver that should receive the message.
        Returns:
        the receiver or null if message processing is finished

      • getCurrentReceiverArguments

        IObject getCurrentReceiverArguments()
        Get the arguments object that should be passed to current receiver.
        Returns:
        the arguments objects or null if message processing is finished

      • callChain

        void callChain(IReceiverChain chain)
        throws NestedChainStackOverflowException
        Interrupt execution of current chain by execution of a given one and when it is completed continue the previous. Puts the new chain into a stack.
        Parameters:
        chain - the IReceiverChain to call
        Throws:
        NestedChainStackOverflowException - if overflow of nested chains stack occurs

      • catchException

        void catchException(Throwable exception,
                    IObject context)
             throws NoExceptionHandleChainException,
                    NestedChainStackOverflowException,
                    ChangeValueException,
                    InvalidArgumentException
        Switch to the chain that should be executed when exception occurs. Saves in context positions (stack indexes and step indexes) of the points in the sequence where the exception occurred ("causeLevel" and "causeStep" fields) and where it was caught - position in the chain defining the called exceptional chain ("catchLevel" and "causeStep" fields).
        Parameters:
        exception - the occurred exception
        context - the context to save positions
        Throws:
        NoExceptionHandleChainException - when there is no such chain.
        NestedChainStackOverflowException - when it is impossible to call that chain.
        ChangeValueException - if error occurs during writing positions to context
        InvalidArgumentException - if incoming argument is null
        See Also:
        callChain(IReceiverChain)
